primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in history through the physical resurrection of Jesus to vindicate His Son, fulfill the Scriptures, and secure a certain, personal future for humanity.

tekstueel_bewijs: I am going to send you what my Father has promised

object.identificatie: Restoration of life and the certainty of a personal future (Hope)
tekstueel_bewijs: the restoration of the life you've lost
Everything must be fulfilled that is written about me
repentance for the forgiveness of sins will be preached... to all nations
you are not going to miss out on anything
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of a gift/fact.

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit ('Power from on high') and Historical Evidence
tekstueel_bewijs: clothed with power from on high
It’s evidence. Jesus wasn’t hungry... He’s trying to say, 'I am not a symbol.'
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides the Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help (clothed) that enables the secondary program.

tekstueel_bewijs: Death has the ability to strip you of everything
cursed is he who is hung on a tree
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just 'bad habits' but the ontological finality of death and the 'curse' of sin.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The disciples (and hearers) becoming witnesses and preaching repentance to the nations.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / Disciples
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (witnessing) is strictly contingent upon the primary program (being clothed with power/the fact of the resurrection).

voorbeelden_mens_subject: We must always live in hope
You have to take them as they are
You're going to have to deal with the things the Bible says

voorbeelden: You're going to have to deal with the things the Bible says
The deepest desire of your heart
You should want that he was raised
He opened their minds so they could understand
Clothed with power from on high
Death is taking... every loved one away (Negative Pouvoir)
He did it. He paid it.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Ability' of God to overcome the 'Inability' of man in the face of death. It is a theology of Empowerment/Grace.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from Niet-S1 (Symbolism) to S1 (Historical Fact), then confronts S2 (The tragedy of death) to show how S1 provides the only resolution to S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Receipt' (Resurrection) proving the debt of S2 is paid.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. Death is described as 'crushing' and 'stripping you of everything'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. Jesus is the actor who eats, opens minds, and pays the debt. The hearer is the beneficiary of a 'paradigm-shattering' fact.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: You're going to have to deal with the things the Bible says

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He paid it. It’s like a receipt.
You are not going to miss out on anything.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Paul is used not as a moral example to follow, but as a 'case study' of how the Resurrection changes one's hermeneutic.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already treats Paul theocentrically (God blinded him, God changed his mind).

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and hope; the burden of 'paying' or 'achieving' is removed.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the historical fact to the theological meaning to the personal hope is seamless.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Die in our place, take our sins upon him... He paid it.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' (Power) that the disciples lack.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Serious; described as a 'curse' and 'debt' that requires a 'receipt'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by Christ's action. The hearer is positioned as one whose paradigms are shattered by an external reality.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for an Easter sermon.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Death is already treated as a cosmic opponent.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a textbook example of grace-oriented preaching. It avoids the 'exemplarist' trap and keeps the focus on the objective work of Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the Costco illustration, Greimas shows that the illustration functions as a 'Modal Competence' marker (Savoir/Pouvoir).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the fish; semiotics explains the fish as a 'Helper' to the 'Subject's' claim of reality.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from shifting the hearer from a 'Subject' (trying to live hope) to a 'Receiver' (receiving a future).

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully uses the 'Axis of Transmission' to move the value of Hope from the Sender (God) to the Receiver (Hearer).
